thread.title: Wales' most dangerous roads revealed
thread.title_full: Wales' most dangerous roads revealed | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Wales' most dangerous roads revealed
text:
The A44 between Llangurig and Aberystwyth in Mid Wales has been listed as one of the most dangerous roads in the UK.
The A44 near Aberystwyth in Mid Wales Credit: PA New research by the Road Safety Foundation gave the road a 'risk rating' of 166.6% - the 5th highest of any in the UK.
Between 2011 and 2013, 54% of all accidents on the road were described as 'run-offs', when a vehicle leaves the road due to swerving or similar factors.
Credit: PA The A539 near Wrexham and the A5 near Betws-y-coed were also listed in the study as 'high-risk'.
For the first time, the average risk of death or injury on Welsh roads also came out higher than anywhere else in the UK, with the risk recorded as nearly 80% higher than the risk for the network in the West Midlands.
Last updated Tue 15 Sep 2015 Travel Wales
